alert.note: Alert for Macon (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, Stephens, Habersham, Rabun, northwestern Hart, southeastern Macon and Oconee Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 945 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Hiawassee to 10 miles north of Toccoa to near Carnesville. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Seneca, Franklin, Walhalla, Clayton, Clarkesville, Carnesville, Westminster, Reed Creek and Lavonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
